greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = largest prime factor of n^n - 1.
reference: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
link: Sean A. Irvine, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..126
D. S. Kluk and N. J. A. Sloane, Correspondence, 1979.
program: (PARI) for(k=2, 28, my(x=factor(k^k-1), f=x[#x[, 1], 1]); print1(f,", ")) \\ _Hugo Pfoertner_, Aug 23 2019
results.author: Dennis S. Kluk (mathemagician(AT)ameritech.net)
